thread.section_title: National News -  New York Daily News
thread.title: Authorities closing in suspect in slaying of NYC Google executive
thread.title_full: Authorities closing in suspect in slaying of NYC Google executive

author: DAVID BOROFF
title: Authorities closing in suspect in slaying of NYC Google executive
text:
Authorities have DNA profile, are closing in on suspect in murder of Google executive Vanessa Marcotte Authorities closing in suspect in slaying of NYC Google executive Google employee Vanessa Marcotte was raped and strangled during the fatal attack on Aug. 7. (AP)  21 PM 
Authorities have a DNA profile and are closing in on a person of interest in the Massachusetts killing of Google executive Vanessa Marcotte, a New York City resident. 
The suspect is a Hispanic or Latino man with light to medium-toned skin and an athletic build, Worcester District Attorney Joseph Early Jr. said Thursday. The suspect, believed to be around 30 years old, would have had scratches on his face, neck, hands and arms following the fatal Aug. 7 attack in Princeton, according to Early. 
The person of interest has not been identified because the DNA has been passed through national criminal databases without a hit. 
Marcotte grew up in nearby Leominster and worked as an account manager for Google in New York. State police walk down the street after searching through the woods for evidence in August. (David L. Ryan/Globe Staff/AP) 
In November, authorities found a suspicious SUV parked near the site where they discovered Marcotte's body. 
Marcotte disappeared after jogging in Princeton while visiting her mother. She was raped and strangled after she attempted to fight her attacker. 
With News Wire Services
